titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Werner Pfeiffer Collection, 1953-2017
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Werner Pfeiffer

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Streett January 2018

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Prints, drawings, paintings, collages, sculptures and artists books created by Pfeiffer, as well as publicity material and other records relating to his art career.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Werner Pfeiffer was born in 1937 in Stuttgart in the southwestern part of Germany. He studied at the Akademie der Bildenden Künste in his home town. In 1961 he emigrated to the United States. Initially, he was active as a designer and art director on a variety of projects. In this capacity he received many citations and awards from the New York Art Directors Club, the New York Type Directors Club, the New York Society of Illustrators, and the American Institute of Graphic Arts. His design work has been widely published in the international design literature in magazines such as Graphis, Gebrauchsgrafik, Print, Modern Publicity and Art Direction. In 1969 he was appointed Professor of Art at Pratt Institute in New York. At the same time he assumed the position of director of the Pratt Adlib Press, a publishing venture of the Department of Graphic Art at Pratt. In the late 1960s he started to concentrate exclusively on his own work as sculptor, printmaker and painter. He lives in Red Hook, a small community in the mid-Hudson region in New York State.

His books, collages, drawings, prints, paintings and sculptures have been shown internationally in more than 100 group exhibitions and in over 75 solo shows in countries such as Canada, Chile, Colombia, France, Germany, Israel, Sweden, Switzerland and throughout the United States.

Over the years he has received numerous public sculpture commissions from the State of Connecticut, the Federal Government of Germany, the State of Niedersachsen in Germany and the State of Massachusetts. Commissions in the private sector include projects for corporations such as Baxter International, Chemical Bank, Zürich, the Hartford Insurance Group, Lackwerke Wülfling, Daimler-Benz Credit Corp./USA and the Hartford Courant, a part of the Time Mirror Group.
Besides being part of many private collections here and abroad, his work is represented in major museums, and university and public collections throughout the world.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Prints, drawings, paintings, collages, sculptures and artists books created by Pfeiffer, as well as publicity material and other records relating to his art career.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection processed by Werner Pfeiffer before transfer to Vassar College.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired in multiple accessions, beginning in 2016, as gifts from Werner Pfeiffer.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Werner Pfeiffer Collection, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

scopecontent.p: There are 90 images, each on a field 8" x 10", drawn on tissue paper between February 7 – February 13, 1978. They were done as a linear study of moving images, with sharp edged, aggressive expressions. The scroll is 78' long. 27 of these images were later used in Errantry, a documentation of all the conflicts and wars of the 20th century.
